attributes.action: reinstate free break time milk for all schoolchildren.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
•Currently, milk is only free for under 5s in certain areas.
•Milk is a good way to keep children well hydrated.
•One serving will provide a 6-year-old with half his/her calcium.
•Dentists recommend water or milk as being best for teeth.
•Milk provides nutrients such as vitamin A, calcium, magnesium and zinc, which children with poor quality diets may miss out on.
•Children with milk in their diet tend to have better overall nutrient intakes than those who don’t.
•Adults who did not drink milk as children are unlikely to do so later and therefore may have lower nutrient intakes and be at risk of poor bone and dental health. 
•School milk and fruit combined provides a more complete nutrient package than fruit alone.
•When set against long term savings to the NHS, the annual cost of £35 per child will be more than offset.
•This scheme would be an ideal partner to the already successful free fruit scheme and would provide a much needed boost for the health of Great Britain's population.
